column4: ii'm using ubuntu dapper and the hplip version is too old and i'm using a newer printer and i need to upgrade
do i have to compile myself and if so, how should i go about uninstalling ubuntu's hp
I recommed you using the lattest version of Ubuntu. There has been some improvements in the printing system since Dapper.
it depends on the speed of your internet connection, in order to download the needed files.
you can burn a Alternate CD to do the upgrade from the CD. It will save some disk space. How much free space do you have ?
also, can I be sure edgy will work on my system?
probably yes, since it is an improvement from Dapper. You may run it from a LiveCD to check for specific compability. But Edgy is not the latest version, the latest is Feisty (7.04).
another version will be released within a month, it is called Gutsy (7.10)
you'll probably have to download around 700mb of files. If you have more than 1gHz of processor and 256mb of RAM, after the dowload things should be installed withing an hour.
don't forget to make backup of your personal files before trying an upgrade
could it corrupt the hard disk?
corrupt the disk ? No, but it can lead to an unstable install if something goes wrong, requiring a new fresh instal. But it quite rare.
that's why backuping is always necessary
but if i dual-boot windows then i'll just take my files from there
other partitions and OSes should not be affected by any error.
yes. This is an important task. Is requirable as much condoms for sex :P
